Name: Lilongwe
Description: Lilongwe is the capital of Malawi.

Name: Blantyre
Description: Blantyre is the economic capital of Malawi.

Name: Karonga
Description: Karonga is a city in northern Malawi located on the coast of Lake Nyasa.

Name: Mangochi
Description: Mangochi is a city in Malawi.

Name: Monkey Bay
Description: Monkey Bay is at the southern end of Lake Malawi (Lake Nyasa), in the Southern Region of Malawi.  It is a small port town, home to large monkey population and gateway to Cape Maclear and the world heritage listed Lake Malawi National Park.

Name: Nkhata Bay
Description: Nkhata Bay is a small, bustling fishing village of about 15,000 inhabitants, located about 50 kilometers from Mzuzu.  Straddling the steep, verdant mountains of Malawi's rift valley, Nkhata Bay overlooks the lake like a lord overlooks his manor.

Name: Nkhotakota
Description: Nkhotakota is a town in Central Malawi. It has a population of just over 20,000, and is located on the shore of Lake Malawi.  The town itself is quite basic, with a few basic hotels that cater predominantly to the domestic market.  However, there are several lake-side resorts catering to the foreign tourist market.

Name: Zomba
Description: Zomba is a small town in Malawi about 1 hr from Blantyre. It was the capital of Malawi until Hastings Kamuzu Banda, the first President, moved the capital to Lilongwe. Most travellers visiting Zomba are coming for the Zomba Plateau.

Name: Likoma Island
Description: Likoma Island, along with its sister Chisumulu Island, is in the Mozambican territorial waters of Lake Malawi/Nyasa. Both Likoma Island and Chisumulu belong to Malawi.

Name: Mua
Description: Mua Village, Mua Mission and the KuNgoni Centre of Culture and Art are in the Dedza district of Malawi.

Name: Zomba Plateau
Description: Zomba is a small town in Malawi about 1 hr from Blantyre. It was the capital of Malawi until Hastings Kamuzu Banda, the first President, moved the capital to Lilongwe. Most travellers visiting Zomba are coming for the Zomba Plateau.

Name: Lake Malawi National Park
Description: Lake Malawi National Park is in Southern Malawi and an UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Liwonde National Park
Description: Liwonde National Park is in Malawi.

Name: Majete Wildlife Park
Description: Majete Wildlife Reserve is in Chikwawa of Malawi.

Name: Nyika National Park
Description: Nyika National Park is a national park in Malawi, right next to the Nyika Plateau National Park in Zambia. With 3200 kmÂ² it is Malawi's biggest national park.

Name: Ntchisi Forest Reserve
Description: Ntchisi Forest Reserve is in the Central Region of Malawi.
